title: Moment Usain Bolt and pals are caught up in a mass brawl
text:
Former Olympic sprinter Usain Bolt was caught up in a mass brawl outside a London club after a night of partying.

The Jamaican athlete, 33, and five friends clashed with another group while partying alongside Love Island stars at Soho's Toy Room in London.

The row - which involved up to 30 people - spilled out onto the pavement outside the venue, with revelers reportedly throwing punches and kicks.

Footage taken on a mobile phone shows Bolt trying to diffuse the tension by dragging his friends away from the bust-up.

Bolt was seen partying in the venue earlier with a group of friends. His group were said to be in good spirits when they arrived at the club shortly after 1am. Pictured: Bolt dancing inside Soho's Toy Room in London before the violence erupted

He was also seen wading into a scrum to break it up.

Bolt and his group of friends had earlier been spotted rowing with seven Eastern Europeans inside the London venue where Love Island champion Amber Gill was launching her MissPap clothing collection.

One witness told The Sun: 'It all happened so quickly. As soon as it calmed down little one-on-one fights kept breaking out.

'It was pretty terrifying. I thought it was never going to stop.'

Bolt was later pictured with his arm around one of his friends in an attempt to drag him away from the violence.

Another witness said it was 'madness' and that Bolt managed to resolve the situation.

The violence - which involved up to 30 people - spilled out onto the pavement outside the venue, with revelers throwing punches and kicks

The Jamaican athlete, 33, and five friends clashed with another group while partying. Bolt dances inside the club on Friday night

The sports star then left from outside the venue shortly after 3am, separately to his friends.

Others at the club said that his group arrived at around 1am and seemed in good spirits.

Amber, 22, was joined by fellow Love Island stars Molly-Mae Hague, Anna Vakili and Amy Hart. None were believed to have been involved in the incident.

Bolt and his group of friends had earlier been spotted rowing with seven 'Eastern Europeans' inside the London venue where Love Island champion Amber Gill (pictured) was launching her MissPap clothing collection

Tommy Fury (left) and Molly-Mae Hague (right) also attended the fashion bash in London on Friday

Bolt won eight gold medals over three Olympics but retired back in 2017.

A Met Police spokesman said: 'Officers were called to an altercation on Argyll Street at 3.10hrs on Friday. There was no trace of any victim or suspect at the scene.'
description: The Jamaican athlete, 33, and five friends clashed with another group while partying alongside Love Island stars at Soho's Toy Room in London on Friday night.
